subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Thursday, May 24, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the time.

Today on the Ticker 

Schumer: Gonzales will face no-confidence
vote

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The U.S. Senate will
take part in a vote of no-confidence on embattled Attorney
General Alberto Gonzales after debate on the immigration bill
is completed, Democratic Sen. Charles Schumer said Thursday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/schumer-gonzales-will-face-no.html

***

Bush supports provisions of war-funding
bill

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Just hours before
the House is set to vote on a $120 billion supplemental funding
bill for Iraq and Afghanistan, President Bush gave it a plug
Thursday, saying it would "support our servicemen and women in
harm's way."

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/bush-supports-provisions-of-war-funding.html

***

Bush warns of heavy fighting in Iraq this
summer

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- As Congress was
poised to approve money for U.S. forces in Iraq on Thursday,
President Bush warned Americans to expect "heavy fighting" this
summer during a critical time in his war strategy.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/2007/POLITICS/05/24/bush/index.html

***

New Jersey governor: 'I
should be dead'

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Following
his near fatal car accident, New Jersey Gov. Jon Corzine is
appearing in a new ad on behalf of the Department of
Transportation, urging passengers and drivers to use seatbelts.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/new-jersey-governor-i-should-be-dead.html

***

Romney 'shocked' by Edwards 'War on Terror'
comments

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Former
Massachusetts Gov. Mitt Romney became the latest GOP
presidential candidate Thursday to criticize former Sen. John
Edwards' recent renunciation of the term "War on Terror,"
saying he was "shocked" when he heard the comments.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/romney-shocked-by-edwards-war-on-terror.html

***

Clinton dances, asks voters to pick
song

WASHINGTON (CNN) - New York Sen. Hillary
Clinton posted a new video Thursday asking supporters to choose
her presidential campaign song, combining a montage of video
and suggestions sent into the campaign over the past week.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/clinton-dances-asks-voters-to-pick-song.html

***

GOP opponent assigns Giuliani
homework

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Texas Rep. Ron
Paul questioned former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani's
qualifications to be president Thursday, suggesting he would
not support him unless he'd read several specific books and
"report back to me."

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/gop-opponent-assigns-giuliani-homework.html

***

Giuliani: Dems in denial over 'War on
Terror'

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Former New York
City Mayor Rudy Giuliani sharply criticized fellow presidential
candidate John Edwards Wednesday, saying that the former North
Carolina senator's renunciation of the term "War on Terror" is
evidence Democrats are in "denial."

Full story:http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/giuliani-dems-in-denial-over-war-on.html

***

Brownback touts support from 'Roe'

Washington (CNN) - In an uphill climb to win the Republican
nomination for the presidency, Sen. Sam Brownback, R-Kansas, is
touting a new endorsement by one of the nation's icons in the
abortion debate.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/brownback-touts-support-from-roe.html

***

Gallup: Giuliani, Edwards lead in favorability
ratings

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Former New York
City mayor Rudy Giuliani has the highest favorability rating
among the top Republican and Democratic presidential
candidates, according to a new Gallup poll. 

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/gallup-giuliani-edwards-lead-in.html

***

Ahead on CNN

Raw Politics
tonight: Clinton's memo, Giuliani's homework
assignment

Hillary Clinton's campaign was
supposed to sail into the democratic nomination like a great
ocean liner, but it is springing leaks...and she's not happy
about it, CNN's Tom Foreman reports in tonight's "Raw
Politics."

Also, GOP presidential candidate Ron Paul
says Rudy Giuliani needs to read several books before he is
qualified to be president.  

And more signs "Law and
Order" actor Fred Thompson may run for president.

Catch "Raw Politics" tonight on Anderson Cooper 360, 10
p.m. ET
